snippet: Some reports have “air rage” incidents rising sharply, while others seem to indicate that Americans are the world’s best-behaved airline passengers.
abstract: Joe Sharkey On the Road column observes some reports have 'air rage' incidents rising sharply, while others seem to indicate that Americans are the world’s best-behaved airline passengers.
lead_paragraph: Some reports have “air rage” incidents rising sharply, while others seem to indicate that Americans are the world’s best-behaved airline passengers.

headline.print_headline: Defining What Qualifies As Anger in the Air
headline.seo: Air Rage Might or Might Not Be Increasing - On the Road
headline.main: Defining What Qualifies as Anger in the Air
